About Young Starter Club

We're a vibrant learning community dedicated to nurturing talents, building confidence, and creating joyful learning experiences for children and adults alike.

Our Story

Where Passion Meets Education

Young Starter Club was born from a simple belief: that everyone deserves access to quality education in the things they're passionate about. What started as a small music teaching venture in 2010 as HeartOfPsalms has blossomed into a comprehensive learning hub offering music, badminton, arts, cooking, and photography programs.

We began in a house studio and have grown to serve over 80 learners. Now is the time to expand, but our focus remains the same - providing excellent instruction in a warm and supportive environment.

Our Foundation

Vision, Mission & Values

The principles that guide everything we do at Young Starter Club

Vision

Young Starter Club envisions a well fostered community where all students, parents, and the working staff have accesss to an empathetic social environment. We strongly believe that relationships anchored in integrity, compassion, and social responsibility will be a transformative approach to excellence in service, in learning, and in camaraderie.

Mission

Our mission is to provide access to a translatable benefit of excellent teaching approach, methods, and materials at an equitable cost to all aspiring learners of all ages. Learnings must be translated to their growth in musicality, artistry, and all facets of life. The end goal is to achieve a well-developed individual with strong confidence, integrity, purpose, and excellence

Core Values

  • Responsibility
    Being accountable for one's action and commitments
  • Integrity
    Being honest and holding high ethical standards
  • Compassion & Empathy
    Showing care for one another and understanding others’ feelings
  • Excellence
    Striving for the highest standards in all endeavors
  • Growth and Learning
    Embracing a mindset of continuous self-learning and improvement
  • Critical Thinking
    Encouraging the ability to think critically and solve problems
  • Community Engagement
    Fostering a sense of belonging and connection with the wider community
  • Honesty
    Being truthful and transparent in all dealings
  • Respect
    Treating others with dignity and valuing diverse perspectives
Our Journey

Milestones & Growth

From humble beginnings to a thriving learning community

2010

The Beginning

Our humble beginnings took off in this year through the efforts of Ms. Silayan as a simple home service for music lessons.

2013

Expansion

Silayan Music Studio was born and had a great leap to what is now called Young Starter Club.

2015

Diversification

Introduced cooking sessions and photography classes, and Badminton in collaboration with Jefferson Tablante Training Camp(JTTC) becoming a true multi-disciplinary learning center.

2020

Innovation

Adapted to hybrid learning models, ensuring continued education during challenging times.

2026

Thriving Community

Celebrated over 80+ students served and countless success stories across all our programs.

Leadership

Meet Our Team

Passionate about transferring the knowledge

Desiree Tablante

YSC Co-Builder, Administrative & Operations Management, Program Consultant, Culinary Program Specialist, Client/Student relations expert, IT Consultant.

With 20+ years of Management Expertise and Graduate of Mapua Insitute of Technology; BS Industrial Engineering.

Silayan Pallones

YSC Builder, Program Head

Associate in Music Ministry, major in Voice. She's a Graduate of Bob Jones University, Greenville, SC, USA. A Multi-skilled musician, Recording Artist, Choir Conductor, Composer, Lyricist, Performer, Resourse Speaker, Educator, Visual Artist, and Music Producer

Katherine Kay Brutas

Violin Teacher

Well- experienced Violin Teacher/Coach Experienced Piano Teacher Orchestra Assitant Conductor Orchestra Principal Player PH-based & International Students Coach for Student Conventions Skilled Arts Teacher/ Coach Bachelor of Music Education St. Scholastica’s College

What Sets Us Apart

The Young Starter Club difference

Expert Instructors

Certified professionals with real-world experience and a passion for teaching.

Small Classes

Personalized attention with small student-to-instructor ratios.

Supportive Environment

A welcoming space where mistakes are learning opportunities.

Holistic Development

Building skills, confidence, and character through diverse programs.
